physicalDescription.extent: 1 item photograph, 10 x 8 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: "#1049 Maurice Epstein." Caption on image: "Cartoon published in the Denver Post. Sunday, December 30, 1923."

mods.abstract: Cartoon of Maurice Epstein with a photograph head and cartoon body. He holds three caps and around him are more drawn pictures and writing. Counter clockwise from the top, ''Maurice likes to burn up the roads in his big Lincoln.'' On a billboard near a car, ''Imperial Caps 'Just a mile above the rest of 'em.''' On a sign, ''This is Mr. Epstein owner of Midwest Cap Wrks. Biggest cap factory west of Chicago!!'' Near a factory, ''''Imperial' Midwest Caps going to important centers.'' Trains traveling to San Fransisco, Los Angeles, and New Orleans. Finally, a man is walking away saying, ''Mine is a Midwest cap!''
mods.accessCondition: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance.
